name: Embassy Suites Chevy Chase Pavilion

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one night while on a business trip. This location was picked because it would be very convenient for my next morning's meeting. Check-in was quick and courteous.
reviews.title: Excellent location and spacious rooms

likes.liked: — Large rooms, comfortable beds, metro access

reviews.text: The Embassy Suites usually has large rooms and this was no exception. The room was clean, well supplied with toiletries and the King-sized bed was extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Happy with our choice: BUT

likes.liked: — location, cleanliness, metro, shopping, complimentary hot breakfast
likes.disliked: — overcharging us on the parking, need for more personnel at the front desk

reviews.text: The included Happy Hour was okay. The service was excellent and the staff was quick to ask if there were any problems with the room or accommodations and responded quickly by reporting a wet slippery floor in the elevator right away. The snacks and wine offered at the Happy Hour were marginally appetizing.
reviews.title: Noisy but there aren't many options around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The included Breakfast in the morning was also served with a smile and had a lot of choice of both hot and cold selections.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

likes.liked: — clean, comfy, stylish

reviews.title: Great spot to stay
reviews.text: The only problems I had were with the internet connection. Based on my Hilton HHonors profile internet access is supposed to be be free - and it was. The problem was I had to re-enter a promotion code every hour I was connected to the Internet. Very inconvenient and annoying.
Stayed for seven days with three teenage children in July of this year. Large corner suite on third floor. Quiet,clean and spacious.
reviews.title: Perfect

likes.liked: — The spcious suite and the breakfasts.

reviews.text: Check in was straightforward, welcome letter personally addressed in suite with complementary water.
reviews.title: Lots of Money For Little In Return

likes.liked: — Location

reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent with the best omlettes ever! Attended manager's reception on three occassions and a variety of snacks and chips were on offer as well as a large selection of alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel!

likes.liked: — The hot breakfast, and access to the Metro
likes.disliked: — It was some distance from Downtown DC

reviews.text: All staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The breakfast area was never untidy and staff were pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Convenient, comfortable & great overall Hotel

likes.liked: — convenience to metro and cooked to order breakfast

reviews.text: The location was fine with shopping centre accross the road,supermarket approximately five minutes away and a quiet shopping mall directly under the hotel.
reviews.title: Liked it!

likes.liked: — location

reviews.text: All the previous reviews about this Embassy Suites have been true: it is great. Very well managed. Friendly and helpful staff. Contemporary interior design makes rooms pleasant and comfortable. Plus, it is directly connected to the Red Line of the Metro subway via an underground walkway, making a short ride to all the attractions in downtown D.C. The hotel is located in an upscale retail and residential area. Neiman Marcus and Sak's are across the street, as is a Ritz-Carlton. We stayed here three nights and could not have been more pleased.
reviews.title: First-Class Embassy Suites hotel in great location

likes.liked: — Well-maintained with attractive rooms with contemporary furnishings

reviews.text: Great hotel. Wonderful, spacious rooms. Awesome breakfast. Connected to subway station.
reviews.title: Great for tourist with kids.

reviews.text: From the minute we walked in we knew we had chosen the right place. The hotel is very convenient as it is located directly across the street from the Metro station. We drove our car and the parking is $15.00 a day but very safe. The front desk people were very helpful with directions and any requests we had. It is nice to be greated with smiling faces. The room was spotless and more than adequate for 3 adults. We had a slight problem with the TV but when we reported this to the front desk someone was there within 5 minutes to fix the problem...along with several bottles of complimentry water. The breakfast in the morning was great! Made to order eggs, pancakes,potatoes,a variety of meats and baked goods. And again the service was just great. The only problem was with the in-room internet. Don't get it! The browser is very old and you can not get on many sites. When we reported this to the manager in the morning he was more than happy to refund the cost. There are alot of nice hotels in the area, but it is the attentive staff that makes this hotel the place to stay.
reviews.title: What a Gem!!!!!

likes.liked: — The comfortable beds and amble room

reviews.text: Our family of five just returned from a great stay at the Chevy Chase Embassy Suites in Washington DC. The hotel came highly recommended and it STILL exceeded our expectations. Being a cynical business traveller I thought it would be hard to impress me... but honestly - the staff, facilities, food were all terrific. All members of our family agreed (Husband, children aged 4 (twins) and a 10 yr old). Other reviewers have amply stated the assets and amenities. This is a lovely, safe, beautiful hotel in a stunning neighborhood (our room overlooked Neiman Marcus, Bloomies) and lovely homes on the other side. This was a lovely respite in the throngs of spring break DC tourist season!
reviews.title: Excellent Embassy!!

likes.liked: — Everything

reviews.text: We just finished a four day stay over Easter weekend at Embassy Suites Chevy Chase after a friend of a friend who lives in Washington DC recommended it. We are a family of five, kids ages 13, 11 and 8, and there was plenty of room in the suite. We had a suite with a king size bed, queen pull out sofa and ordered a rollwaway bed which fit nicely at the foot of the king. We got around the city almost exclusively via the Metro. The access to the Metro is very good and does not require you to leave the hotel to get there. Tip - You do not want to be driving in Washington! There are a million traffic lights and once you get to where you are going, finding a parking spot is difficult to say the least. Take the Metro everywhere and walk. It is safe and very convenient.
reviews.title: Easter weekend away with family

reviews.text: The Embassy complementary breakfast is excellent and exceeded my expectations. Also, there is a Starbucks on the first floor of the mall which was a bonus! The kids looked forward to a frappacino in the late afternoon after a day of sightseeing. In addition, there are plenty of good restaurants within the complex (Cheese Cake Factory and Maggiano's) as well as within walking distance (Chadwicks for a very good lunch or Clydes for dinner).
reviews.title: Beatiful Hotel

likes.liked: — no answer

reviews.text: The pool, although not big was very adequate for my eight and eleven year old. The hot tub is next to the pool and was good size. There is also a quality work out room directly adjacent to the pool area.
reviews.title: Lovely and convenient!

likes.liked: — convenience and comfort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Across the street is a Galleria, with a Neiman Marcus, a Bloomingdales behind that, and a Lord and Taylor behind that. The Galleria has a movie theater if the weather doesn't cooperate. One note: they are building a new store across the street on the Galleria side of the hotel and they begin work at 7:00 am. If this doesn't wake you up the ambulance/fire truck that goes by seemingly early will wake you. Weekends were much quieter.
reviews.title: What Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed At the Chevy Chase Pavilion/Embassy Suites on a Friday Night to Saturday. It was the perfect for a little weekend taste of DC. The hotel could not be any close to the metro, its actually on top of it. The Hotel itself we thought was great! At Check in, the people at the front desk were very helpful, and friendly, Our room, a suite, was perfect for my husband and I, and a friend. The sofa fold out into a bed, and was quite comfy, and quite. The 5:30-7:30 reception was nice, the snacks were great, and any drink you want! Great! the breakfast was great, something for everyone. Loved being able to go the mall just steps from your room too, very unique! It was great being so close to the Cheesecake factory too, I've never eaten there before, cheesecake was awesome, and after a long day, its so nice to be able to walk out the door of the cheesecake factory, and go to the elevator to your room. We paid $249, for a suite, taxes, parking, breakfast, evening reception, and the convenience. And it was a convenience for sure!
reviews.title: Perfect for wht we needed!

likes.liked: — location to the metro
likes.disliked: — pool could of been open longer

reviews.text: Wife and I just got back from DC. This property has some pluses. Location is excellent. Just go underground, hop on the metro, and get anywhere in the area. Breakfast is fine, and worth taking advantange of. Size of rooms is standard embassy. Cheesecake factory is located in the same building as the hotel and it a good option. Two problems experienced. Bugs. We saw roaches of small/medium sizes. Obviously, this is unacceptable. And we saw them everyday. Also, tv in the living space was HD, but the HD channels seemed to always have technical dificulties. Elevators are slow also. I would not stay there again, but the price was fair and location superb.
reviews.title: Hotel was bugged

likes.liked: — Location

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in late June. The hotel was full during our stay but this never created a problem with congestion at the complimentary breakfast or manager's cocktail reception.
reviews.title: Great location: nice hotel

likes.liked: — The spacious room
likes.disliked: — The noisy family who slammed doors every 10 minutes next door. We were moved!

reviews.title: High class location
reviews.text: The two room suites were well furnished and spacious. Floor 3 is the floor with smoking rooms and guests should note it is the noisiest particularly in rooms adjacent to the breakfast room/bar.

reviews.title: Loved the hotel
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and helpful at all times. Car parking in the multi storey car back next door worked well.

We had three rooms at this hotel for a family 'reunion' in the area. We have 3 kids and found it very convenient with the kids. The room was large enough to sleep 6 comfortably with the pull out bed in the living room.
reviews.title: great stay with the family

likes.liked: — convenience - everything we needed was right there in the pavillion - food, shopping, metro

reviews.text: The 'bar' area has not a full kitchen, but a sink, small fridge and microwave - very handy. My mom had a handicap room down the hall which was just enormous. The setup is a little 'strange', as the hotel is basically on the upper floors of this open type mall, but this made it very convenient - lots of room to walk around and shop - we also ate and got take out from the Cheesecake Factory which is right downstairs in the mall. There are also many restaurants right outside the 'pavillion', on the main street.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Business or Leisure

likes.liked: — Location, great condition of the hotel

reviews.text: The metro stop is under the mall - you have to take a couple different elevators to get down to it, but its right there and very convinent - on the red line, which goes right by the zoo and then into downtown. The pool isn't huge, but decent size. The hot tub was very large. We didn't use the health club, but it looked clean and well equipped.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Cleanliness of entire property.

reviews.title: Excellent location for all of the sites of D.C.!!!!!!
reviews.text: In the evening the 'managers reception' had snacks - goldfish, veggie tray, fruit tray and usually some type of hot appetizer. After spending the day in DC we would go sit down and have some snacks and a drink - great way to unwind. The full breakfast was also very convenient - the food was okay (eggs and omlets cooked to order - okay, but not stellar), but there was so much to choose from that you could certainly fill up - they had just about everything you could imagine -pancakes, cereals, muffins, etc in addition to the cooked to order stuff - and the wait staff was phenomenal - with 3 kids I have my hand full and they were great to help carry trays, get juice for us, etc.
We'll definately be returning the next time we go to DC
reviews.title: perfect family hotel with access to everything

likes.liked: — Metro stop right in the building

aka: Embassy Suites Chevy Chase Pavilion Hotel Washington Dc
description: A Destination Hotels & Resorts property, the Embassy Suites Hotel at the Chevy Chase Pavilion offers award-winning hospitality and exceptional value. Located in the upscale Friendship Heights district in Washington D.C., directly on the Metro Red Line, the Embassy Suites Hotel offers the best of both worlds, half-way between the Bethesda-Rockville, Maryland business corridor and near Washington D.C. businesses and sites, yet in walking distance of the renowned Chevy Chase shopping district.
